intro: Oldenlandia inconspicua, commonly known as the smallflower spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in umbels, often with a distinctive hairy appearance. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its overall rugged appearance. Oldenlandia inconspicua thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along stream banks.
